To identify the income arising in the course of the entity's core operating activities from the income statement, we need to look for line items that reflect income generated specifically from the main business operations, excluding auxiliary or financial activities.

The key line item typically representing core operating income is "Main Business Revenue," as it indicates revenue directly from the entityâ€™s primary activities.

Analyzing the given income statement:
- "Main Business Revenue" is listed as 5,991,764.34.
- "Total Revenue" is a summation (which matches "Main Business Revenue" in this case), so it also reflects core operating income.

Since "Main Business Revenue" directly pertains to core operating activities, this value is the relevant income arising from those activities.
